subject: Learning
title: Socrates and the Power of Questions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Socrates and the Power of Questions usable.

hook.text: Socrates never lectured. He asked questions until his students discovered the answer themselves.

buildup.text: The Socratic method uses guided questioning to expose contradictions in a student's thinking.

discovery.text: By forcing students to defend their beliefs, Socrates made them active participants in their own learning.

twist.text: Athens put him to death for it. His questioning was seen as corrupting the youth.

climax.text: Two millennia later, law schools and philosophy departments still use his method daily.

punchline.text: The best teacher in history never gave a single answer.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of the Socratic method?
options: Using guided questions to help students discover answers
